intro.description: This cheat sheet shows the general usage of JCrypTool and alleviates your first steps in this extensible cryptography e-learning software.

item.title: Switching between perspectives
item.description: JCrypTool comes with two perspectives: Default and Algorithm. You can switch between those two perspectives in two different ways: By using the Window - Open Perspective menu entry or by using the icons in the upper right of the window. Only one perspective can be active at a time (you can recognize the active one by the selected icon).

subitem.label: Activate the Algorithm Perspective by selecting the menu Window - Open Perspective.
Activate the Default perspective again by using the Default icon in the upper right of the application.

item.title: Opening a view
item.description: JCrypTool contains an almost countless number of views. The easiest way to open one is to use the menu Window - Show View. You can use both editors to create new files and you can open arbitrary files with them.

subitem.label: Open the Web Browser view by using the menu Window - Show View.
Open the frequency analysis. All analysis, visuals and games are views. To do this click on the menu item "Analysis" and select the entry "Frequency Analysis"

item.title: Opening an editor
item.description: JCrypTool contains two editors: text and hex. You can use both editors to create new files and open arbitrary files in any of them as well.

subitem.label: In order to create a new file click the New icon in the toolbar. This opens the JCrypTool sample file in the Texteditor. Select the arrow next to this icon and click on New file in Hexeditor to create the sample file in the hex editor. A new file can be generated via the File - New menu as well.

An existing file can be opened via the menu File - Open File or via the Open icon in the main toolbar. The file will be opened automatically in the assigned editor. You can change these assignments in the preferences. Alternatively you can select a file in the File Explorer view and open it with a double click. This opens the file in the assigned editor too. To open a file in a certain editor right click on it in the File Explorer view and select Open with in the context menu.

item.title: Editing Preferences
item.description: Verify or change some of the many preferences in the JCrypTool preferences.
